title:
Alphabet, Wabtec, Flex LNG And More On CNBC’s ‘Final Trades’ - Alphabet 
(NASDAQ:GOOG), Flex LNG (NYSE:FLN
text: Get All the Market Moving News, Squawk, and Mentorship NOW Get All the Market Moving News, Squawk, and Mentorship NOW On CNBC’s "Halftime Report Final Trades," Steve Weiss of Short Hills Capital Partners said he has bought  some puts on  Invesco QQQ Trust QQQ. Jenny Harrington  of Gilman Hill Asset Management, LLC said  FLEX LNG Ltd.  FLNG has a 12% dividend yield. On Feb. 7, Flex LNG posted better-than-expected earnings for its fourth quarter, while sales missed market estimates, according to data from Benzinga Pro. Don’t forget to check out our  premarket coverage here Kari Firestone  of Aureus Asset Management named  Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies Corporation  WAB as her final trade. On Feb. 26, Wabtec priced its public offering of $500 million of 5.611% senior notes due 2034. Wabtec posted weaker-than-expected earnings for its fourth quarter on Feb. 14. Joe Terranova  of Virtus Investment Partners picked  Alphabet Inc.  GOOG GOOGL. Alphabet’s Google CEO Sundar Pichai recently addressed the recent uproar over the company’s Gemini AI chatbot, which has faced criticism for generating historically inaccurate images and text. Acknowledging the issue for the first time since the Gemini controversy broke out last week, Pichai said that it is "completely unacceptable" in an internal memo reported by Semafor.
